verse:
नाहमिज्याप्रजातिभ्यां तपसोपशमेन वा ।
तुष्येयं सर्वभूतात्मा गुरुशुश्रूषया यथा ॥

terms.prajātibhyām: the higher birth of brāhmaṇa initiation

vedabase.translation: I, the Soul of all beings, am not as satisfied by ritual worship, brahminical initiation, penances or self-discipline as I am by faithful service rendered to one’s spiritual master.
vedabase.purport: The word prajāti here indicates either begetting good children or the second birth obtained by ritual initiation into Vedic culture. Although both of these are praiseworthy, Lord Kṛṣṇa here states that faithful service rendered to a bona fide spiritual master is still higher.

terms.गुरुशुश्रूषया: through devotion and service to the guru

gpt.meaning: I cannot be pleased through external rituals and sacrifices or through austerity and self control. The soul of all beings can be pleased only through devotion and service to the guru, just as I am pleased.
